title: Spiritual Gifts Assessment
description: Discover the areas where God has uniquely gifted you to serve others and the body of Christ. This 50-item tool helps you reflect on your strengths across various spiritual gifts.

questions.question: I enjoy helping others with practical tasks, even when it goes unnoticed.
I am fulfilled when I contribute in the background to make things run smoothly.
I notice opportunities to serve that others often overlook.
I gladly take on responsibilities that free others to lead or teach.
I often encourage others when they feel down or discouraged.
I enjoy speaking hope and motivating others to trust God more.
I am quick to remind others of God’s promises during difficulties.
I naturally notice people who need encouragement or affirmation.
I often take initiative to guide and organize people toward a goal.
I feel confident making decisions that affect a group.
I can motivate others to move toward a shared vision.
I enjoy setting goals and helping others achieve them.
I am generous with my resources and find joy in giving.
I give cheerfully, even when it requires personal sacrifice.
I often look for opportunities to support ministries or individuals financially.
I prefer contributing resources quietly rather than seeking recognition.
I trust God to provide, even when situations seem impossible.
I remain hopeful and confident in God when others doubt.
I often inspire others to rely on God in tough circumstances.
I feel a deep assurance that God will act when I pray in faith.
I enjoy teaching and explaining spiritual truths clearly.
I find it natural to prepare lessons that help others understand Scripture.
I enjoy answering people’s questions about faith and the Bible.
I prefer accuracy and clarity when handling God’s Word.
I can sense when something is not aligned with God’s Spirit or truth.
I recognize when teachings are biblically unsound or misleading.
I sense hidden motives or spiritual influences in situations.
I often discern whether someone’s actions come from God or human will.
I feel compassion and empathy for those who are suffering.
I am drawn to comfort those who are grieving or hurting.
I feel a strong urge to help when I see others in distress.
I often put myself in someone else’s shoes to understand their pain.
I am bold in sharing my faith and inviting others to follow Jesus.
I look for opportunities to talk about God with those who don’t believe.
I am energized when I see someone respond to the gospel.
I feel burdened when people around me don’t know Christ.
I enjoy praying for others and often see God answer in powerful ways.
I feel led to pray consistently for specific people or needs.
I naturally pray for extended periods without losing focus.
Others often ask me to pray for them because they trust my prayers.
I can see how biblical truths apply to real-life situations.
I often give advice that others find wise and practical.
I can explain how Scripture applies in complex situations.
I tend to weigh options and choose paths that align with God’s wisdom.
I can speak God’s truth with boldness, even when it’s uncomfortable.
I often sense God leading me to deliver timely encouragement or correction.
I sometimes share messages that feel inspired for a specific situation.
I am willing to say hard truths if I believe God wants me to.

Service.characteristics: Meeting practical needs and supporting others behind the scenes.
Service.blindspots: May undervalue their contribution or avoid leadership.
Service.advice: Your service is vital — keep serving joyfully.

Encouragement.characteristics: Building up others with words of hope and comfort.
Encouragement.advice: Encourage with both love and truth.

Leadership.characteristics: Guiding and organizing others toward vision and mission.
Leadership.advice: Lead with humility, pointing people to Christ.

Giving.characteristics: Generosity with time, money, and resources.
Giving.advice: Continue to give cheerfully as God leads.

Faith.characteristics: Deep trust in God that inspires others.
Faith.advice: Help others grow in faith patiently.

Teaching.advice: Connect truth with love and daily life.

Discernment.characteristics: Recognizing truth from error and spiritual authenticity.
Discernment.advice: Use discernment with humility and love.

Mercy.characteristics: Compassion for the hurting and suffering.
Mercy.blindspots: Risk of burnout or overidentifying with pain.
Mercy.advice: Balance care for others with self-care.

Evangelism.characteristics: Sharing the gospel and inviting people to Christ.
Evangelism.blindspots: May focus on conversion over discipleship.
Evangelism.advice: Walk with new believers beyond the first step.

Intercession.characteristics: Strong calling to pray for others.
Intercession.blindspots: Can feel unseen or spiritually drained.
Intercession.advice: Stay refreshed in God’s Word while interceding.

Wisdom.characteristics: Applying biblical truth to real-life decisions.
Wisdom.blindspots: May lean too much on personal logic.
Wisdom.advice: Stay grounded in Scripture as the foundation.

Prophecy.characteristics: Boldly speaking God’s truth to encourage or correct.
Prophecy.advice: Always speak the truth in love.
